clinical_study.brief_title: Naloxone Treatment in Skåne County - Effect on Drug-related Mortality and Overdose-related Complications
clinical_study.official_title: Naloxone Treatment in Skåne County - Effect on Drug-related Mortality and Overdose-related Complications

brief_summary.textblock: Death in overdose is the single most common cause of death in people using heroin. In Sweden, the number of drug-related overdose deaths has increased gradually since the early 1990s. The purpose of the study is to investigate the effects of a Naloxone distribution program in Skåne County. The primary issue is whether the project had an effect on overdose mortality and overdose related injuries.

primary_outcome.measure: Overdose mortality in the general population
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
primary_outcome.description: Overdose mortality deaths 2019-2023 to be compared with historical overdose mortality during 2013-2017. Number of deaths will be collected from national registries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reaction level of ambulance-attended opioid overdose survivors in the general population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of responsiveness in acute brain disorders using Reaction Level Scale (RLS-85) in ambulance. The RLS scale is graded from 1 (awake, no delayed reaction, oriented) to grade 8 (unconscious, no movements to painful stimuli).

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory rate of ambulance-attended opioid overdose survivors in the general population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate (breaths per minute) registered in ambulance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate of ambulance-attended opioid overdose survivors in the general population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate (beats per minute) of opioid overdose survivors registered in ambulance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Naloxone or other antidot administered by ambulance staff to ambulance-attended opioid overdose survivors in the general population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Naloxone or other antidot, if needed, administered by ambulance staff in opioid overdose survivors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Need of ambulance transport to hospital of ambulance-attended opioid overdose survivors in the general population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: The need to transport the opioid overdose survivors to hospital - information registered in ambulance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of opioid overdoses attended by ambulance or emergency hospital care
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 years (first outcome measure for the 18-month intervention period July 1, 2019 - Dec 31, 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of opioid overdoses attended by ambulance or emergency hospital care, information registered in ambulance or emergency hospital care.

secondary_outcome.measure: All cause mortality in included patients
secondary_outcome.description: Number of deaths will be collected from national and regional registries.
Overdose mortality in included patients. Number of deaths will be collected from national and regional registries.
Retention in naloxone program - number of patients.
Number of incidences of witnessing opioid overdoses.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence in naloxone use and bystander CPR
secondary_outcome.description: Number of incidences of naloxone use and bystander CPR.

arm_group.description: The prospective cohort consists of study subjects receiving Naloxone nasal spray in the distribution program.
Data from the historical control cohort will be collected from national registries years 2013-2017.

intervention.description: Naloxone Nasal Spray will be distributed at the addiction centres.
Historical data will be retrieved from quality registries.

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of subjects treated at the Addiction centres of Skåne County. Naloxone Nasal Spray will be handed out to these subjects, who must be able to understand the given information about the use of the drug.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subjects treated at the Addiction centres of Skåne County
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- subjects unable to understand study information due to psychiatric co-morbidity or severe language difficulties
